comment.author: 16333811@N00
comment._content: Visitors to this photo page are encouraged to comment on this image here and then add their research/insights/comments about this image to the Inauguration project at the Flickr Commons group. Thanks!

comment.author: 84539227@N00
comment._content: The United States National Museum (USNM) Building is today better known as the Arts and Industries Building.  It is currently vacant.

comment.author: 47651360@N03
comment._content: for the any remaining relatives of american soldiers who were assigned here in the philippines, particularly in the town of dumangas, province of iloilo in the years 1899-1902.... if you have any pictures of our church before it was burned down by the soldiers, please or can you post it here on flickr...... we are palnning to restore the church for historical and cultural purposes, but we dont have any clues on how our church looked like during those years.... thank you...

comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content: I used this image in a post I wrote about Garfield's inaugural ball. susanbarsy.com/2013/02/03/all-about-a-ball/ Thank you for making it available. Susan Barsy, PhD OUR POLITY

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content:
Hi Susan,

Thank you for letting us know! If it's possible to put the credit near the photographs, that would be preferable.

Best,
Effie, Smithsonian Institution Archives

comment.author: 74471476@N08
comment._content: The blogging software I use make it difficult to caption the photographs individually.  Besides the link at the bottom, a complete credit appears when a reader moves a cursor over the image.  In that sense, each is credited to the institution as indicated on The Commons's guidelines.  If this is not adequate, let me know and I will alter the post.  Thank you again.  SB

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: That should be fine. Thanks for letting us know, Susan.
